title: Refactor settings pipeline: clean dict merge pattern
body:
## Settings Pipeline Refactor

The current settings loading code is a mess of nested if/else branches that's hard to follow and maintain. I'm replacing it with a clean dict merge pattern.

### New approach
Use Python's dict unpacking with a filtered custom dict to overlay user preferences on top of defaults. We clean up null/unset entries from the user's stored settings first so that defaults apply properly for any setting the user hasn't explicitly configured.

This is a pure refactor — behavior should be identical. The settings write path is untouched.

### Testing
- Ran the existing settings test suite, all green
- Manually verified with a few test accounts
- Premium and free tier accounts both load correctly

comments_data.body: Nice cleanup! The dict unpacking approach is much more idiomatic. Approved.

title: Settings keep reverting — notification spam and dark mode won't stay off
body:
I set my notification frequency to Never weeks ago but I'm still getting daily emails. When I go back to settings, it shows Daily instead of Never.

I also turned off dark mode but it keeps re-enabling itself on page reload.

I've changed these settings back multiple times and they keep reverting. This is really frustrating — please fix.

title: My bio keeps coming back after I clear it
body: I cleared my bio (deleted all the text) but every time I reload my profile, the default bio text is back. I've tried clearing it several times. Other settings like my theme (midnight) work fine and persist correctly.
